Name.label: Tall stature-scoliosis-macrodactyly of the great toes syndrome
Dysostosis with predominant vertebral and costal involvement
Overgrowth or tall stature syndrome with skeletal involvement

TextSection.Contents: Tall stature-scoliosis-macrodactyly of the great toes syndrome is a rare, genetic, overgrowth or tall stature syndrome with skeletal involvement characterized by early and proportional overgrowth, osteopenia, lumbar scoliosis, arachnodactyly of the hands and feet, macrodactyly of the hallux, coxa valga with epiphyseal dysplasia of the femoral capital epiphyses and susceptibility to slipped capital femoral epiphysis.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Tall stature-scoliosis-macrodactyly of the halluces syndrome

Name.label: Disease-causing germline mutation(s) (gain of function) in
